When I messaged Jacob he was apologetic and tried to help, but eventually, he let us shorten our stay which I know is a big deal so I am grateful. It can be a good value for the right travelers, for those comfortable staying in a more rustic place, this unit can work.

There was coffee and absolutely nothing else. I've never stayed in an AirBnB that had nothing for breakfast. Nothing.
The most difficult thing was the transportation situation.
If you don't have a car, your in for a $25 taxi ride to town, one way, or a mile or so walk to the bus stop. Very very expensive and inconvenient.

Thanks, Heidi and Adam……Your home is SO wonderful (down to all the little details)!! A very comprehensive house rules/information book that was incredibly helpful. We did/visited many of the things/places that were suggested in the book, so take the time to read it. The basics were covered….private room with TV and full bath, comfortable bed and pillows, great location, safe environment, and could use the living/dining/kitchen/deck spaces. And then all the extras….had body wash/shampoo/conditioner in the shower, had a special shelf in refrigerator marked off for our stuff, could use the washer/dryer with all the products supplied, had use of the kitchen including spices…..as well as an unbelievable view!! We walked a lot, but also used cabs (rather expensive) and the town buses to get around.
MUST DO……Totem Bight State Park (take the bus….can get a day pass, read the signs and learn a lot), visit the Salmon Market (get the samples, but don’t forget to take home your favorites), stroll around downtown (go early cause some shops close at 4:00), walk the Rain bird Trail (so beautiful and peaceful), visit the Ketchikan Public Library, as well as sit on the deck at the house and enjoy the view!
FAVORITE EATS……New York Cafe (fresh and yummy), Pioneer Cafe (breakfast served all day), Alaska Crepe (locally owned and family run), and Cape Fox (great views and good food).
Now…it is YOUR turn to book Heidi and Adam’s place. If we are ever back in Ketchikan, we definitely will again!

We rented a car which makes it easier to get around, especially to drive every evening to Herring Cove to join a small group of local people for black bear watching. We were rewarded on our third attempt with four fascinating and active bears. We also had a fun excursion with Ketchikan Kayak Eco-Tour and saw a pod of humpbacks up close and personal.
We can only most highly recommend a stay at Mountain Point of View, make it as long as you can, it’s the perfect base to explore Ketchikan and the island.
